00006  * File     : cb_timer.h
00007  *
00008  * Description: Contains functionality for software timers.
00009  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00010 #ifndef _CB_TIMER_H_
00011 #define _CB_TIMER_H_
00012 
00013 #include "cb_comdefs.h"
00014 
00015 #ifdef __cplusplus
00016 extern "C" {
00017 #endif
00018 
00019 /*===========================================================================
00020  * DEFINES
00021  *=========================================================================*/
00022 #define cbTIMER_INVALID_ID      ((cb_int32)-1)
00023 
00024 /*===========================================================================
00025  * TYPES
00026  *=========================================================================*/
00027 
00028 typedef cb_int32 cbTIMER_Id;
00029 
00030 typedef void (*cbTIMER_Notify)(
00031     cbTIMER_Id  id,
00032     cb_int32    tag1,
00033     cb_int32    tag2);
00034 
00035 
00036 /*===========================================================================
00037  * FUNCTIONS
00038  *=========================================================================*/
00039 
00040 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041  * Initialises the timer module. Typically called from start handler. 
00042  * Must be called after cbOS_init.
00043  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00044 void cbTIMER_init(void);
00045 
00046 
00047 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048  * Starts a periodic timer. Resolution specified by cbTIMER_RESOLUTION_MS.
00049  * - period: Time in milliseconds.
00050  * - expireCallbFcn: Callback function that is called when timer expires.
00051  * - tag1: User defined tag that is used in callback.
00052  * - tag2: User defined tag that is used in callback.
00053  * The function returns the timer identifier.
00054  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00055 cbTIMER_Id cbTIMER_every(
00056     cb_uint32              period,
00057     cbTIMER_Notify         expireCallbFcn,
00058     cb_int32               tag1,
00059     cb_int32               tag2);
00060 
00061 
00062 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00063  * Sets a timer to expire after delay milliseconds with a resolution specified
00064  * by cbTIMER_RESOLUTION_MS.
00065  * - delay: Time in milliseconds.
00066  * - expireCallbFcn: Callback function that is called when timer expires.
00067  * - tag1: User defined tag that is used in callback.
00068  * - tag2: User defined tag that is used in callback.
00069  * The function returns the timer identifier.
00070  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00071 cbTIMER_Id cbTIMER_after(
00072     cb_uint32              delay,
00073     cbTIMER_Notify         expireCallbFcn,
00074     cb_int32               tag1,
00075     cb_int32               tag2);
00076 
00077 
00078 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00079  * Cancels a previously started timer. Note, that the timer might already
00080  * be expired and the expire callback function might just have been called.
00081  * - id: Timer identifier returned in the cbTIMER_after call.
00082  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00083 void cbTIMER_cancel(cbTIMER_Id id);
00084 
00085 #ifdef __cplusplus
00086 }
00087 #endif
00088 
00089 #endif /* _CB_TIMER_H_ */
